## Introduction

The (European) Pareto distribution is probably the most popular distribution for modeling large losses in reinsurance pricing. There are good reasons for this popularity, which are discussed in detail in Fackler (2025). We recommend  Philbrick (1985)  and Schmutz *et.al.* (1998) for an impression of how the (European) Pareto distribution is applied in practice. 

This package provides functionality (like CDF, PDF, Layer Mean, Layer Variance, simulation, etc.) for the local Pareto distribution as introduced by Riegel (2025) and for the special case of the log-affine local Pareto distribution.
